alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:05PM MDT until July 31 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON COUNTY... At 605 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding and mudslides along Highway 126 northwest of Deckers. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in this area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Jefferson County, southwest through northwest of Deckers. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cabin Creek, Gunbarrel Creek, Wigwam Creek, Buffalo Creek, South Platte River, Horse Creek, Fourmile Creek and Goose Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause flash flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in steep terrain.
